did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: This collection documents Equal Justice USA's efforts to abolish capital punishment and reform the criminal justice system nationwide.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives by Equal Justice USA Executive Director Shari Silberstein in 2008 and 2016.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Equal Justice USA is a national organization that seeks to create a fair, effective criminal justice system. Its campaign to end capital punishment is the group's largest and longest-standing program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of subject files, clippings, mailings to Equal Justice USA supporters, other correspondence, moratorium resolutions, legislative resources, annual reports, newsletters, and some case files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
